questions.question: Janet ……………………. be here soon.
questions.description: We use should to indicate possibility.

questions.question: …………………………. I turn the heating on?
questions.description: We use should to ask for a suggestion.

questions.question: They ……………………… be invited to the party.
questions.description: We use should to express necessity.

questions.question: People ………………………. obey traffic laws.
questions.description: We use should to express necessity.

questions.question: You …………………………… say things like that to Granny.
I …………………………. call if I arrived early.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I ………………………………. be grateful if you could help me.
questions.description: Both would and should can be used with the first person pronouns with little difference of meaning.

questions.question: ……………………………. you like something to drink?
questions.description: We use would in polite offers and requests.

questions.question: I knew that I ………………………… stop hating her, but it seemed rather difficult.
You ………………………….. have sent the parcel this morning.
You ……………………………. have wasted so much time on this.
